level.ecm_name: Optimal StartUp and ShutDown for heating
level.description: This control ECM enables to implement optimized heating system schedules which account for the time that the building takes to reach required temperature set-points and stay close to them until the building is occupied. In such way, relevant comfort DPIs and energy DPIs can be optimized.

level.application: Update in scheduling of heating systems.
level.advantages: Enables to quickly implement modifications in the usage of building HVAC systems based on available information on building usage and occupants comfort.
level.disadvantages: The ECM may require functional tests and parameters calibration to achieve optimal performances with respect to standard scheduling. Information about building occupancy and building/zone temperature must be available as well as feedback from building occupants.
level.links_to_barriers: This control ECM implementation requires hardware (such as timer, smart thermostat or BMS) and measurement system (temperature sensers)
level.installation_data: Installation must be performed according to the BEMS installation guidelines
level.maintenance_data: Maintenance must be performed according to the BEMS maintenance guidelines
